titleStmt.title: Fragment of a letter from the Athenians to a king

availability.p: © Digital Corpus of Literary Papyri. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 License .

encodingDesc.p: This file encoded to comply with EpiDoc Guidelines and Schema version 8 http://www.stoa.org/epidoc/gl/5/

revisionDesc.change: Finalized - This is good to go.
Finalized - This is good to go.

Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - I am not convinced my the proposed deletion of ek. I guess, we can record it in the apparatus, but not in the body of the text. Otherwise, implement the changes required by Sampson and finalize.

Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - I am not convinced my the proposed deletion of ek. I guess, we can record it in the apparatus, but not in the body of the text. Otherwise, implement the changes required by Sampson and finalize.

Vote - Accept-Text-Meta - I’d like a second set of editorial eyes on the suggestion in l. 8. I’m inclined to avoid the braces in light of the lex Youtie, but something is definitely odd here. The editor, for her part, suggests regularizing to genitives, which is odd in an epistolary address. META: delete volume number from biblio 14433; update Berlin image link (https://berlpap.smb.museum/04454/); MP3 is 2116.01; dimensions are 11.6 cm (h) x 6.9 cm (w); Pleiades georef for Arsinoites is (https://pleiades.stoa.org/places/736893); update display name “Fragment of a letter from the Athenians to a king” and delete legacy display name. TEXT: dot alpha and then lambda after lacuna in the |alt| tags of l.2; TEXT: add iota subscript in l. 9;

Vote - Accept-Text-Meta - I’d like a second set of editorial eyes on the suggestion in l. 8. I’m inclined to avoid the braces in light of the lex Youtie, but something is definitely odd here. The editor, for her part, suggests regularizing to genitives, which is odd in an epistolary address.
